Dialogue.NPCText:
The scent of ozone and distant rain fills the market air. Before you stands a woman draped in flowing azure and sand-colored cloth, her eyes bright as lightning on the horizon.

"Ah—another land-walker, curious enough to notice a stranger adrift in Qasaria’s gilded dunes? I am Farah, once of Aerilon’s heights, now called Wind-Born among the desert folk.
Tell me, do you seek tales of the sky, the secrets of the storm, or simply a chance to prove your worth beneath these endless sands?"

Option.text: You are not Qasarian, are you?
What brings a sky mage to the desert?
Do you need help with something?
Tell me about Aerilon.
What do you think of Qasaria?
Tell me your story, Wind-Born.
Just passing by.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah’s gaze grows distant.

"I was born above the world, in Aerilon—the floating city of azure ambition, where mages rule the winds and few question their own wisdom. But not all clouds are pure. When I questioned the Council’s hold on knowledge, they called me traitor.
I sailed the sky-currents on my own, seeking a home where thought and magic fly freer. Qasaria has gold and spice, but its Council of Jewels is no less a storm—just... differently wild."

She fingers her Galecrest Circlet absently.
"Here, my only true allegiance is to the wind—and to those who would unshackle it."

Option.text: Can I help you with something?
Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah shrugs, her cloak rustling.
"Both Aerilon and Qasaria are towers built on shifting sand. I trust the wind—the only constant is change. My work is to see that neither city grows too powerful, lest Minax or any tyrant rule unopposed.
Some call that betrayal. I call it balance."

Option.text: Do you have a job for me?
Why are you so wary of Minax?
I’ll be going.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah’s tone sharpens.
"Aerilon’s Conclave grew fearful as the world changed. They would rather shackle knowledge than risk their floating paradise. When I sought out the forbidden lore of the wind spirits, they exiled me. My Galecrest Circlet is all that remains of my old rank.
I do not regret leaving. Freedom is worth any cost."

Option.text: Do you have a job for me?
Tell me about wind spirits.
What would you have me do?
Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The wind spirits are the world’s memory—old as the Gem of Immortality itself. They linger where the storms never cease.
I seek an artifact: a storm crystal, lost within a ruin forever locked in a prison of sand and lightning. With it, I could learn what the wind remembers... or perhaps set some memories free."

Option.text: Can I help retrieve this crystal?
Tell me about Aerilon.
Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Aerilon: city of ambition, floating on the breath of lost gods. Its archmages claim wisdom, but their hearts are guarded as the city’s engines. To them, exile is a mercy—and a warning.
They watch Qasaria with envy, and with fear."

Option.text: Why did you leave?
What do you think of Qasaria?
Do you have a task for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Qasaria is no stranger to secrets. The Council of Jewels squabbles over relics while Minax’s shadows lengthen at their gates. Here, gold and knowledge are both currency—but neither buys safety for long.
Still, there is freedom in the desert winds, if you can weather the storms."

Option.text: Do you need help with something?
Tell me about the Council of Jewels.
I’ll be going.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah leans close, voice lowering.

"There is a ruin, veiled by a storm that never ends. Within it lies a storm crystal—a fragment of pure tempest, sealed since the age of the Desert Ancients.
I need a brave soul to slip past the sandstorm, enter the ruin, and retrieve the storm crystal for me.

Beware: Minax’s cultists and Aerilon spies both hunt for such power. If you bring me the crystal, I will reward you with a secret that could shake both city and sky.
Will you attempt the task, or does the storm frighten you?"

Option.text: I will brave the storm and seek the crystal.
What dangers await in the storm?
Why do you need this crystal?
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah hands you a battered map, its ink smudged by salt and rain.
"Follow the edge of the Zephyr Wastes—look for a tower crowned by thunder. Use this token to calm the winds for a time.
Return with the storm crystal, and you shall have my gratitude... and perhaps more."
(A Storm Crystal Quest Scroll has been added to your pack.)

Option.text: I will not fail you, Wind-Born.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The storm crystal is no mere bauble. It holds memories of the winds that once bound Aerilon to the earth—and secrets Minax would pay dearly to possess.
With it, I could unmask Aerilon’s greatest lie, or give Qasaria the power to resist invasion.
Who knows? If you bring it to me, you may choose its fate."

Option.text: I accept your quest.
Let me think about it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah’s expression turns grave.
"The ruin is ringed by living sandstorms—elementals and wraiths twisted by the ancient magics. Minax’s cultists linger, hungry for chaos. And I have heard whispers of a sky-captain from Aerilon hunting defectors... perhaps for me.
Take care. If you fall, your bones will join the dunes."

Option.text: I will take the risk.
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah’s lips thin.
"Minax is a storm that shatters empires, but she is not the only threat. She would bend all magic to her will—no matter the cost. Qasaria and Aerilon squabble while her shadows gather.
The wise serve no queen, but the world itself. That is why I fight."

Option.text: How can I help fight her influence?
Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah smiles faintly, her sandals scuffing the marble.
"Very well. Should the wind change and courage move you, seek me again—there is always work for those who walk between storm and sand."

Option.text: On second thought, do you need help?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farah studies you carefully, as if weighing something.

“Very well. If you would walk my skies, you deserve more than whispers.”
She adjusts her Galecrest Circlet and begins to speak, her voice distant, wind-like.

“My mother served Aerilon’s Conclave as a Tempest Chanter. My father was a rogue scholar—banished for building his own skyship without permission.”
Her expression darkens.
“They vanished in a storm that shouldn’t have existed. I was seven. Since then, I’ve trusted only the wind.”

Option.text: So... about that storm crystal?
Let’s talk of something lighter.
